Not noxious or anything, it smells pleasant. But it smells like hairspray to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1641393"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1641393#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1640584" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1640584" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shaven"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1167536"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1167536.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shaven" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/The-Pour-Un-Ete-4436.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4436.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Pour Un Ete"title="The Pour Un Ete"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1640584ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1640584" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1167536">Shaven</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-07">09/07/22 21:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It seems my perfume taste has been vastly changed and evolved since I started to get seriously interested in the world of fragrances. A few years back, I had a chance to test Vaara(I was just beginning to appreciate niches). Little too strong for my light floral sensibility, novice as I was. Here I am, collecting and testing a variety of genre, even the heavy orientals I used to avoid. After testing this again recently, I immediately thought, boy, this is the totally different scent from what I remember! <br />
<br />
Lovely fruity opening like a burst of fresh juice followed by delightful melange of flowers. The name, brand's description initially give the impression of spicy/rich oriental. This is actually not heavy at all, more like warm fruity floral with a touch of spice and wood. I am so happy with my purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1640584"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1640584#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1637412" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1637412" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Alces Alces"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068731"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1068731.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Alces Alces" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Senteurs-Gourmandes/Tendre-Madeleine-43168.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43168.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tendre Madeleine"title="Tendre Madeleine"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1637412ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1637412" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068731">Alces Alces</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-03">09/03/22 12:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The saffron and quince opening just blows me away! And the middle notes just get warm and sweet like rose pie, if that were a thing. The long dry down....smoky honey and sandalwood. It's the smell of autumn going into winter, of taking a long walk in the cold wind and coming inside to sit by the fire with a cup of chai tea. So beautiful. 10/10. I get about 4 hours out of this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1637412"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1637412#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1637268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1637268" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="M-as-Marin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1202613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="M-as-Marin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Oud-Wood-1826.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1826.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Wood"title="Oud Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1637268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1637268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202613">M-as-Marin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-03">09/03/22 08:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara by itself is a good fragrance if we ignore all the comparisons with some other rose-forward fragrances.During my time with this scent, I had three main issues. One is it is not worth over $200 USD no matter how good the presentation looks, who was the perfumer, and how many natural ingredients are there inside.<br />
<br />
The second issue is with the performance. It is not bad as for example Jo Malone fragrances tend to be, but for this amount of money, the quality of the fragrance isnt at the highest level I wanted for more than four hours.<br />
<br />
The third and last complaint was the capture of the spirit of Jodhpur. If no one told you, I highly doubt you would guess right which country was the inspiration for this creation.<br />
<br />
TOP NOTES<br />
Vaara opens up with a thoughtful and carefully mixed watery rose, and a mixture of quince with hints of spices. The rose here is watery but much soapier than todays standards. It mostly reminds me of fragrances that used this kind of rose in perfumes from 30 to 50 years ago that were worn by maybe a little more mature and well-dressed ladies of high society.<br />
<br />
HEART NOTES<br />
As the fragrance gently transitions into the floral heart, the rose starts to settle down, and the magnolia switches places with the citruses from the opening.<br />
<br />
I have to point out that for this amount of money, the fragrance is shockingly sharp and synthetic which pinches my nose in the wrong way.<br />
<br />
However, the fragrance shines the most when its fully dried down when woody, spicy and sweeter aspects get their chance to play the main role.<br />
<br />
BASE NOTES<br />
There is no denying that Vaara is primary a floral fragrance, and womens fragrance, no matter what Penhaligons marketing is trying to tell you.<br />
<br />
The unisex part comes from the base notes when the honey, musk, and saffron get intensified. There are zero sandalwood, benzoin, and tonka beans notes here, but what I found is a high dosage of Iso E Super which can mimic javanol  industrially made sandalwood, musk, and cedarwood notes.<br />
<br />
I bet that Bertrand knew that without Iso E Super this fragrance would be completely gone from the skin in one to two hours.<br />
<br />
Read the full review at scentgrail.com</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1637268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1637268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1613935" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1613935" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gfp"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/795046"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="gfp" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Estee-Lauder/White-Linen-542.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.542.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Linen"title="White Linen"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1613935ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1613935" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/795046">gfp</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-31">07/31/22 01:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very delicate perfume. It smells like a new born baby or a doll's head. I still have to wait and see about longevity and sillage. for all ages</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1613935"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1613935#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1610941" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1610941" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="5xSecrets!"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1470624"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1470624.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="5xSecrets!" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1610941ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1610941" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1470624">5xSecrets!</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-26">07/26/22 11:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara is a beautiful and tender rose fragrance perfect for spring and summer. It's light, cool and refreshing, but without  aquatic or citrus notes. It has become a summer favorite, in particular in the heat we're having these days. <br />
<br />
Rose and the florals take the main stage from the opening, as it dries down, it gets more woody and lightly spicy.<br />
<br />
To me Vaara is a fairly unique unisex and versatile rose centered fragrance. It's interesting and unlike any other rose I've come across. Yet feels familiar and is easy to wear, even in an environment where you have to be careful with fragrances such as an office setting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1610941"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1610941#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1604623" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1604623" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marimarooo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1484568"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="marimarooo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nest/Indigo-26845.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26845.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Indigo"title="Indigo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1604623ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1604623" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1484568">marimarooo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-17">07/17/22 00:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'll be completely honest, I was a bit let down by this. Reading the reviews I expected this to be super unique and amazing. I really enjoy it, but it is a bit overhyped. I absolutely love the opening, the quince and saffron are so gorgeous there. Sadly the opening doesn't really last and it turns into a nice rosewater scent. I wish it had more spice, I wish the quince was more present, I wish there was more to it in the dry down. Also this lasts only 4 hrs on my skin. On my clothes I get around 6 hrs though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1604623"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1604623#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1604010" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1604010" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hardcandy74"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305840"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1305840.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hardcandy74" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juliette-Has-A-Gun/Vengeance-Extreme-13031.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13031.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vengeance Extreme"title="Vengeance Extreme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1604010ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1604010" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305840">hardcandy74</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-16">07/16/22 01:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unfortunately this smells like a bitter spice on me. Lovely box and bottle, but not for me. Will be selling on.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1604010"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1604010#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1595348" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1595348" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iRiSOnHoliday"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516272"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="iRiSOnHoliday" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1595348ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1595348" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516272">iRiSOnHoliday</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-02">07/02/22 09:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara was inspired by the Royal House of Marwar-Jodphur in Rajasthan and offers a unique glimpse into the aromatic world of a Maharaja.<br />
<br />
Ingredients:<br />
alcohol denat., aqua (water), parfum (fragrance), geraniol, citronellol, linalool, benzyl cinnamate, benzyl benzoate, isoeugenol limonene, euhenol, benzyl alcohol, citral.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1595348"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1595348#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1454232" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1454232" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MaquiLab"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254834.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MaquiLab" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1454232ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1454232" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834">MaquiLab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-29">11/29/21 01:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The initial spicy blast is quickly overthrown by a creamy sweetness. I can definitely feel the florals, but not any one in particular. Unfortunately, this was very short-lived on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1454232"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1454232#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1438533" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1438533" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TunyaPe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.733870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TunyaPe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Fils-de-Joie-62872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fils de Joie"title="Fils de Joie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1438533ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1438533" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870">TunyaPe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-01">11/01/21 16:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara is something else...<br />
It is a ball of happiness <br />
<br />
Many comments below already nailed the review what can I say :))<br />
This is the only citrusy fragrance that I own (for now) and LOVE as it is so exotic, spicy, zesty, effervescent, and special. I would bathe in it.<br />
<br />
Some might think Vaara is just rose/saffron water, but there is definitely more to it. The perfume nose is very detail-oriented, in my opinion.<br />
It is uplifting yet does not feel bubbly. Airy but not light. Cheerful yet elegant &amp; sophisticated enough. Seems suitable for summer/spring but can definitely be worn all year round.<br />
<br />
Dear Penhaligon's, please do not discontinue this princess...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1438533"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1438533#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1382245" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1382245" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alphairone"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213298"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1213298.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alphairone" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Claudio-La-Viola/La-Lettera-Da-43914.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43914.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Lettera Da..."title="La Lettera Da..."></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1382245ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1382245" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213298">alphairone</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-27">07/27/21 06:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Another day, another quince. Yesterday, I wore and reviewed Galop d'Hermes where quince is a featured player, and here with Vaara, it shares a leading role with sweet rose and Peomosa peony, all seeming sun-kissed after a light rain, dewy and fresh. While I do tend to gravitate to darker, jammier, damascone-heavy rose, it is a pleasure to find that elusive cool, watery rose that resonates with me. Often, a rose of this type gets a bit too artificial in the heart, with a bit too much of that aldehydic, waxy Rosalva that can nag and sneer, wearing out its welcome. There is saffron, but it mercifully plays nice rather than competes for attention.<br />
<br />
The heart of the fragrance continues this matrimony of quince and rose, and they waltz around so carefree flanked by a panoply of kindred florals. I do discern in the periphery a jester in the room: carrot seed. Thank you for not making this too 'floofy' for confident wear. It is the edge that I need, as anyone who knows my taste is aware that I really don't like wearing puppy dogs, kittens, and rainbows for fragrance. There's got to be something in the shadows that reminds me that life is a little dirty and messed up, lean into it!<br />
<br />
Finally, the base is understated as Vaara is somewhat linear, so it sort of sneaks up to you and reminds you that too much of a good thing will wear you out, and you need a palate cleanser. So, its woody, resinous end credits overlayed on the closing scene of quince and rose waltz. This is probably one of the best from Penhaligon's, by a country mile.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1382245"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1382245#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1338942" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1338942" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rinmom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/286210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rinmom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/100-Bon/Mimosa-Heliotrope-Poudre-53049.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53049.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mimosa & Hliotrope Poudr"title="Mimosa & Hliotrope Poudr"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1338942ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1338942" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/286210">Rinmom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-06">05/06/21 19:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me Vaara is a very pretty scent.  The delicious quince top note lingers throughout the whole scent journey without being cloyingly sweet as it is well supported by its floral and woodsy frame.  Not a complicated scent either that would change over the day on my skin but I just like its linear performance as this beautiful quince note is what I would die for a full bottle and then an upcoming back up one, and this perhaps my most beloved from Penhaligon's.   Definitely a feminine scent but if for guys or who wants a more unisex comparable, try Byredo Mojave Ghost where the Sapodilla note is so well countered by its pencil shavings.  I have no idea why Fragrantica names both Vaara and Mojave Ghost as Amber fragrances, which obviously these 2 are fruity floral spicy combination.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1338942"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1338942#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1310900" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1310900" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tonkatsu335"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254643"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254643.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tonkatsu335" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Linda-Landenberg/A-Trembling-Rose-47015.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47015.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="A Trembling Rose"title="A Trembling Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1310900ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1310900" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254643">tonkatsu335</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-20">03/20/21 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cheerful rose scent.<br />
It is a gorgeous and juicy scent without being pretentious.<br />
It's a sweet scent, but not sticky, and I like to use it in the summer.<br />
<br />
There is no data available on Fragrantica, but I felt that the middle note was similar to "Sometimes Journey Intoxicate".</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1310900"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1310900#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1304537" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1304537" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tashwakefield"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244694"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1244694.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tashwakefield" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/La-Belle-Paradise-Garden-88873.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88873.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Belle Paradise Garden"title="La Belle Paradise Garden"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1304537ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1304537" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244694">tashwakefield</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-08">03/08/21 18:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Based upon the reviews, I was not sure what this fragrance would be like. I wonder if some have received a knock off, because my opinion is that is is BEAUTIFUL! There is a great deal of rose in it, that's true but there is also an exquisitely feminine complexity to this fragrance from the beginning. As time passes, the full on rose of Vaara is enhanced by an almost spicy woody musk which does not so much as take over as it does emerge and transform. I percieve a beautiful palace garden from the Arabian Nights as the warmth of the afternoon turns to darkness and the fragrances of the flowers change from the heat of day to the cool of night. From the clear precision of rose to a soft and almost smokey combination of cool aquatic rose and blooming night jasmine. I think this might be what Turkish Delight tasted like before it became mass produced and besmirched by Westernisation. Purest rosewater instilled with exotic splendor.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1304537"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1304537#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1285681" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1285681" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumedParrot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/90056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.90056.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumedParrot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Cuir-Beluga-1019.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1019.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cuir Bluga"title="Cuir Bluga"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1285681ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1285681" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/90056">PerfumedParrot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-02">02/02/21 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It just doesnt work with my body chemistry. Against my skin, it brings out a spicy B.O curry vibe with this. Im not sure which note/notes trigger this, but I like to avoid it. It is like Mohur by Neela Vermeire Creations.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1285681"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1285681#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1245083" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1245083" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nick68"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1257270"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1257270.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nick68" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Habit-Rouge-Rouge-Prive-80690.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80690.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Habit Rouge Rouge Priv"title="Habit Rouge Rouge Priv"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1245083ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1245083" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1257270">Nick68</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-05">11/05/20 10:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I blind bought this in Penhaligons recent sale in the UK. Im a big fan of Penhaligons so I thought I would take a risk. <br />
<br />
After spraying it my first thought was please let this die down. I just got a great big hit of Parma Violets (for anyone not in the UK theyre a love/hate lilac coloured florally fragrant flavoured sweet or candy), I quite like them but I dont want to smell like them! <br />
<br />
It dried down to what seemed like Lady Grey Tea (Earl Grey flavoured with bergamot) and hefty floral hint of rose. At this point I was won over. <br />
<br />
As the day wore on Ive definitely picked up the honey and white musk notes mentioned above. Eleven hours after application it is still lingering, great performance throughout the day. <br />
<br />
It does have a feminine slant, I think if youre confident in your own skin and what you wear on it youll be fine and probably appreciate this. <br />
<br />
Not close to anything  Ive ever had before, definitely not for every man and not one for every day wear but I like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1245083"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1245083#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1225811" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1225811" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MyMother&#039;sNo5"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1240881"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1240881.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MyMother&#039;sNo5" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/Bois-Dore-44864.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44864.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois Dor"title="Bois Dor"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1225811ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1225811" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1240881">MyMother&#039;sNo5</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-09-18">09/18/20 01:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An astounding creation. I completely appreciate the inspiration behind it, India, the monsoon, the richness, the overwhelming heaviness, the spices and the heady sweetness... <br />
<br />
If you have ever had the opportunity to try Indian-Bengal sweets or Mishti (Mithai) like Jalebi, they are an assortment of these gooey, sticky, almost sickly sweet but addictive desserts, and this I believe is captured so profoundly in Vaara. Not that this fragrance is too crowd-pleasingly sweet like the popular fragrances saturating the market, but the overall projection of the heady aura is what I believe, the nose hoped to encapsulate. The rosewater, carrot seeds, the quince, honey - unabashedly opulent. The traditional spices transform this sweet floral into a complex, story-telling fragrance. <br />
<br />
While some have classified this as a springtime floral, even light and airy, I wholeheartedly do not treat Vaara as such. In fact, I find this relatively heavy, better for F/W, in order to bring warmth and emotion into a cold, hostile season. Having once worn this during a rainy, cooler springtime day, as I was sitting under my gazebo drinking an earl grey, Vaara bloomed, flourished, prospered with the moist air. I wish to think that the nose had deliberate intent when crafting this formulation, to ensure that Vaara performs so divinely with the chemical interaction of water, reminiscent of the Indian monsoon. <br />
I cannot speak more praise about this. <br />
<br />
There is some general similarity with Guerlain's LPRN Black Perfecto if you want a significantly cheaper, very distant cousin alternative (common notes with Vaara: rose, white musk). Or for a drier, less succulently sweet distant cousin, Versace's Oud Oriental Pour Femme (common notes with Vaara: rose, saffron, freesia, sandalwood). I own all three and can attest to their peripheral similarities, but I believe this to be the case with majority of rose-woody-oudy-leathery fragrances. I am yet to try Bottega Veneta Eau de Velours, but I am sure there will once again, be some common ground, given the composition.<br />
<br />
If you can, do order a sample of Vaara prior to committing to this beauty, because as aforementioned, she is unique..<br />
<br />
11/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1225811"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1225811#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1220332" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1220332" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gumbaline"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934165"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934165.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gumbaline" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1220332ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1220332" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934165">gumbaline</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-09-04">09/04/20 12:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I blind bought this and am so glad I did. It doesn't smell like anything else I own, and to me, while it is very unique, somehow reminds me of something forgotten, maybe from childhood - although I can never pinpoint what. The bitterness of the opening I love, and the florals are light. It feels strong, yet inviting. Love, love, love this. Don't regret buying at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1220332"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1220332#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1181955" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1181955" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="xmelldefrag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1152260"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1152260.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="xmelldefrag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Daniel-Josier/Tuberose-45073.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45073.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tuberose"title="Tuberose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1181955ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1181955" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1152260">xmelldefrag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-29">05/29/20 21:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's really the scent of rosewater.... The one that's usually sold in Turkey... It's sweet, a bit aquatic for me though there's no marine accord here. It conjures up the image of pink roses petals that float in the water. <br />
The dry down is smooth and gentle. Project moderately, but the longevity is good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1181955"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1181955#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1177556" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
