align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1059198"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1059198#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent986019" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc986019" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MademoiselleMaya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/256704"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.256704.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MademoiselleMaya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Alhambra/Kismet-Magic-95138.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95138.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kismet Magic"title="Kismet Magic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma986019ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd986019" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/256704">MademoiselleMaya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-28">09/28/18 07:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Starts with rose water and quince - gentle and acidic. The heart is powdery and slightly spicy - saffron being the only note I can recognize there. Once it hits the powdery phase it becomes classy and has a calming effect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="986019"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=986019#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent939515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc939515" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Perfume Beginners"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092780"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1092780.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Perfume Beginners" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/Ta-if-4922.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4922.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ta'if"title="Ta'if"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma939515ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd939515" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092780">Perfume Beginners</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-04">05/04/18 18:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can smell a hint of spiciness along with the floral scent but I don't know what makes it like that. Maybe it's the smell of quince? I'm not sure as I am not familiar with the smell of quince. The white flowers are obvious as I can always smell them throughout the day. Rose, peony, freesia, I can smell all of them. As for the spiciness, I have to admit that it is what makes it a succeed in terms of formulation and composition. However, personally I don't quite like it. I would absolutely love it more if there is merely floral scent but after all there are so many floral scents in the market and it would not be so special without the hint of spiciness. Now it is not a mediocre one but not one of my favourite. Anyway not a bad choice as it was a bling buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="939515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=939515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent926224" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc926224" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="witch_mum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/50356"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.50356.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="witch_mum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Cedrat-Enivrant-22841.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22841.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cedrat Enivrant"title="Cedrat Enivrant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma926224ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd926224" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/50356">witch_mum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-26">03/26/18 05:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My horoscope promised me for last weekend a new acquaintance - but instead of a good looking man, Vaara came across.<br />
I`ve tried it  a couple of times before, it was nice (some moderate spiciness) but nothing special.<br />
<br />
Last Saturday, I could smell a honeyed rose from the first moment on, and surrounded from all the spices, it was very living, very vibrating. I`ve been bewitched the whole evening (a surprise birthday party for a former colleague and good friend) !</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="926224"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=926224#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent921428" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc921428" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pixie1104"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/824706"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pixie1104" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nivea/Nivea-Sun-53859.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53859.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nivea Sun"title="Nivea Sun"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma921428ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd921428" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/824706">Pixie1104</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-13">03/13/18 05:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you can suffer through the sharp, acrid opening of Vaara then it actually evolves into a really pleasant, if somewhat unremarkable, fresh, green rose fragrance. Personally, Ill be selling my bottle of Vaara as I have other fresh, green rose perfumes that do the job better and without the nose wrinkling top notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="921428"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=921428#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent894368" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc894368" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bubbles1964"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1095199.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bubbles1964" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bastide-Aix-en-Provence/Figue-Amour-48974.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48974.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Figue Amour"title="Figue Amour"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma894368ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd894368" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199">Bubbles1964</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-12-28">12/28/17 12:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought myself a 2ml deluxe tray of 12 Penhaligon's and this is my second time sampling from this house. I also have a 5ml decant of Halfeti and I like that one as well as a solid like for Vaara. <br />
<br />
There is a bitter opening note and I'm assuming that's quince. There's a lot going on in Vaara, but underlying this spicy floral is an exotic vibe, but it's light. Sillage is close to the body with no trail of scent left behind. I'm really looking forward to wearing this in the summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="894368"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=894368#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent872458" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc872458" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="geanina_gandac"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/976275"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.976275.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="geanina_gandac" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coromandel-Eau-de-Parfum-41783.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41783.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coromandel Eau de Parfum"title="Coromandel Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma872458ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd872458" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/976275">geanina_gandac</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-19">10/19/17 22:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The perfume opens with a loud bitter smell where I can detect saffron, coriander and a bitter fruit. The opening is sparkling and bitter. It is like feeling orange blossom but I dont see the note listed. The same bitterness is here.<br />
The heart is still bitter but mixed with a floral odour. At this point is a bitter-sweet fragrance with a wonderful rose note.<br />
The dry-down is sweet, with honey, benzoin and tonka. Now the oriental facet of the fragrance appears. Only a hint of bitterness left behind can be felt now. The sweetness of the honey gives a warmer and pleasant touch.<br />
Vaara is a nice perfume that says close to the skin. Nice and quiet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="872458"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=872458#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent844954" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc844954" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bibibling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/835256"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.835256.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bibibling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Beloved-Woman-15184.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15184.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Beloved Woman"title="Beloved Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma844954ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd844954" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/835256">bibibling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-25">07/25/17 16:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not a proper review but...<br />
<br />
It's a hot and sweaty night, and what smells like Aquolina Chocolovers all of a sudden? Did my bottle break in the other room? It smells so good!<br />
<br />
I was going crazy looking for the source of the scent when I remember I sprayed 6-8 pumps of Vaara on my arms, neck and bra in the afternoon when it was even more hot and somehow my body heat, sweat and Vaara has magically combined to create a lighter, airier summertime version of Chocolovers lol! It must be the coriander, musk and sweet notes. I just had to come and share because I think you guys are the only ones who would understand my excitement!<br />
<br />
In conclusion: Vaara = try it during a heatwave.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="844954"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=844954#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent826016" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc826016" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zilos262"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/45748"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.45748.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zilos262" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Angeliques-Sous-La-Pluie-1023.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1023.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angliques Sous La Pluie"title="Angliques Sous La Pluie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma826016ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd826016" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/45748">zilos262</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-25">05/25/17 17:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My experience with this fragrance was one of luxury. The Penhaligon's counter manager had their various scents lined up on the counter. In front of the bottles laid various teacups, each with their own majestic design, with cotton balls sprayed with their respective fragrances. Vaara i have to say, working in fragrance for almost decade, has been the only fragrance to make me smile and blush. The intoxicating spices with the seductive floral notes of rose and saffron had made my blood rush to my face and i felt the need to hold tighter to the teacup for fear of dropping it. <br />
<br />
Along with be a beautiful and seductive fragrance, its performance is more that perfect. Absolutely long lasting, the sillage is outstanding leaving a trail as the person walk out of the room just lingering. I definitely recommend buying fragrance.<br />
<br />
Bottle wise it has such a simplistic design like most niche fragrance. I was a little disappointed when the metal piece that hold the top in place broke off so easily, but it could've just be a manufacturing error</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="826016"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=826016#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent824835" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc824835" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="anilinam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1065439"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1065439.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="anilinam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Chinatown-1300.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1300.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chinatown"title="Chinatown"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma824835ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd824835" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1065439">anilinam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-21">05/21/17 23:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Missk's comment is on point.  All I can add is:<br />
<br />
1.  Rose scents are very volatile.  I recommend applying an oil prior to spraying; this helps with the issue of longevity.  It's even better if I can use also as a base some rose scented lotion after the oil.<br />
<br />
2.   Sometimes a girl (or, why not a guy) just wants to smell like roses.<br />
<br />
I own many rose fragrances, I love to wear them as a comfort scent, something easy, warm and light for the weekends mostly.  Here's the difference between Vaara and Vera Wang's Truly Pink or Cartier's Goutte de Rose:<br />
<br />
While simple rose scents are linear, Vaara takes you on a journey.  It is an easy journey, one in which someone else is carrying your suitcases.  Bertrand Duchaufour is a genius at giving you a tour.  He presents the magnolia and freesia, the quince, the carrot seeds and coriander,  while carrying a 3 dozen roses bouquet,  as he takes you on this voyage, that begins with a very rosy "feminine" vibe and ends in a more "masculine" cedar and clean musk spectrum.<br />
<br />
I treasure Vaara, and only wear it when I can take the time, to just sit down and enjoy the journey</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="824835"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=824835#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent818187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc818187" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="adice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.885210.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="adice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Histoires-de-Parfums/1804-4486.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4486.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1804"title="1804"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma818187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd818187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885210">adice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-30">04/30/17 15:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dear Vaara, <br />
<br />
You are my sun, my moon, and all of my perfume stars.<br />
<br />
My HOLY GRAIL. You can really smell the quince and rose. If you're not familiar with what a quince fruit smells like I'm not sure how you'll perceive this...but it's a rose water and quince bomb. Lasts through my entire 8 hour office workday with moderate to low sillage. Perfect for spring or summer but can be worn all year round. I mostly get indirect compliments when I wear this such as; "something smells really great over here..." but who needs compliments when you KNOW you smell amazing.<br />
<br />
Forever and always, XOXO</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="818187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=818187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent817342" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc817342" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="missk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7262"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7262.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="missk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kenzo/Parfum-d-Ete-2002-80.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Parfum d'Ete 2002"title="Parfum d'Ete 2002"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma817342ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd817342" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7262">missk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-28">04/28/17 05:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara is an absolutely delightful fragrance. A crisp and refreshing rose scent blended to perfection.<br />
<br />
Vaara is Spring in a bottle to my nose. It's the scent of a garden in bloom intermingling with neighbouring fruit orchards and vegetable patch aromas. I find it very refreshing, easy to wear and super feminine.<br />
<br />
Vaara was commissioned for the Maharaja Gaj Singh and supposedly inspired by the Indian culture and fertile landscapes of Jodhpur. I can sense some exotic elements in this fragrance, but for the most part I find it quite lacking in the spiciness that brings India to mind. <br />
<br />
Perhaps the most unique aspect of this fragrance is the rather delectable carrot seed accord which tends to ground this citrusy rose scent and give it more depth. Vaara is quite a full-bodied fragrance, but with that being said I find it daytime appropriate and would recommend wearing it during the warmer months.<br />
<br />
This perfume is definitely one of my favourites from the Penhaligon's line and I am eager to test this fragrance some more come Spring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="817342"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=817342#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent792934" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc792934" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mellinail"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/361438"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.361438.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mellinail" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Balenciaga/Florabotanica-15512.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15512.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Florabotanica"title="Florabotanica"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma792934ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd792934" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/361438">Mellinail</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-15">02/15/17 06:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I enjoy Vaara on days when I want to recall the scent of a container my mother used to keep on her cabinet of knickknacks. It was a small carved wooden bottle, exotic and lavishly decorated. Inside there was a vial of Rose Attar that was purchased in Bulgaria. The vial had never been opened, and for decades smelled wonderfully of roses and a faint hint of spicy wood from its lavish hiding place. Vaara smells of rose, citrusy wood, and my mother's parlour. To me this is an old fashioned scent, but in a good way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="792934"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=792934#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent750049" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc750049" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Madrona"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/990027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.990027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Madrona" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hugo-Boss/Boss-Intense-388.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.388.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boss Intense"title="Boss Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma750049ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd750049" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/990027">Madrona</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-08">10/08/16 04:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>"Vaara" means "danger" in Finnish, but this perfume is like a declawed kitten. Quince, huh? In that case I like quince. This is a bit sweet, a bit fresh, a bit aquatically splashy, lightly floral and ever-so-slightly fruity. Very pleasing without being annoyingly inoffensive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="750049"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=750049#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent748029" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc748029" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yukaori"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013162"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1013162.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yukaori" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Cherie-213.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.213.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Cherie"title="Miss Dior Cherie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma748029ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd748029" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013162">yukaori</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-01">10/01/16 06:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>sweet honey citrus rose <br />
lovely scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="748029"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=748029#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent736343" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc736343" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Skayalily"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/957767"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.957767.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Skayalily" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma736343ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd736343" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/957767">Skayalily</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-26">08/26/16 10:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I could keep the quince/saffron opening going longer this would potentially be a love. It's a tangy, unique fruit vibe; mouthwatering and juicy, but not sweet. I want to hold onto that quince; I want to like the whole fragrance more than I do. I catch fleeting glimpses of what could be amazing every time I sniff my wrist; and I do have to sniff my wrist, projection is not much off the skin at all for me. But then, as I sniff, it really is just okay. The drydown is all slightly honeyed florals, an almost candied peony takes the lead. But I mostly just miss the incredible quince and saffron. The blending is, typical Penhaligon's lovely. In my experience, they really do know how to balance a fragrance. Now if they could just figure out how to make them project more and last.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="736343"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=736343#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent734188" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc734188" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherry_Darling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1003821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherry_Darling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pascal-Morabito/Perle-Pour-Elle-47506.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47506.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Perle Pour Elle"title="Perle Pour Elle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma734188ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd734188" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821">Cherry_Darling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-19">08/19/16 13:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I fell in love with this perfume at a Penhaligon's shop; it was truly created for an arabian princess (according to the shop owner!) Magnificently complex, sweet, with exotic oriental notes which I later identified as quince and saffron. One of my favorites. Lasts 4-6 hours.<br />
<br />
I have 100+ niche samples for swap within Europe - updated spreadsheet of samples on my profile, get in touch!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="734188"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=734188#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent718388" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc718388" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Emma0714"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/605809"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.605809.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Emma0714" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Olfactive-Studio/Close-Up-40789.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40789.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Close Up"title="Close Up"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma718388ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd718388" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/605809">Emma0714</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-27">06/27/16 03:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very rosy saffron in the beginning. <br />
In Sweden we buy saffron in teensy tiny envelopes, and first spritz of this is literally opening one of these envelopes up.<br />
After 10 minutes the saffron is unfortunately nowhere to be found, but the rose is still there, and there is definitely peony. And now you can smell something else, a mixture of spicy and fruity. <br />
I wouldn't necessarily call this an "oriental" fragrance (which I associate with being more heavy on the spices) - I think it's fresh, youthful and happy. It's unique but not mindblowingly so. <br />
Perfect for summer evenings. <br />
<br />
I get more Coachella vibes than I get Calcutta vibes tho'.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="718388"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=718388#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent704818" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc704818" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Enrosadira"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981470"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.981470.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Enrosadira" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Halfeti-31396.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31396.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Halfeti"title="Halfeti"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma704818ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd704818" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981470">Enrosadira</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-12">05/12/16 05:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Profumo molto interessante.<br />
Discreto, intrigante e piacevole.<br />
 un fiorito leggero, arricchito da rosa, zafferano e un pizzico di spezie calde.<br />
 un profumo fresco ma al contempo rassicurante e sognante, che rientra nella mia "comfort zone" per la sua versatilit, in quanto adatto a qualsiasi occasione.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="704818"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=704818#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent669998" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc669998" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AlisonD"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/916350"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AlisonD" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Instant-Magic-1106.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1106.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Instant Magic"title="L'Instant Magic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma669998ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd669998" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/916350">AlisonD</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-23">01/23/16 01:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well clearly I don't smell what everyone else does.<br />
It's an interesting pleasant perfume, but I don't detect musk or rose.<br />
The quince spices and freesia are the overwhelming notes for me.<br />
You need to like this unusual combination a lot to enjoy this perfume. Sadly I don't.<br />
I'm glad others enjoy it more than I do.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="669998"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=669998#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent656957" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc656957" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RubyBirdy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/954069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="RubyBirdy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Loves/White-Rose-Lemon-Leaves-37576.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37576.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Rose & Lemon Leaves"title="White Rose & Lemon Leaves"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma656957ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd656957" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/954069">RubyBirdy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-14">12/14/15 17:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ever get the feeling that Penhaligon's are laughing hysterically at us as they slap a bow, a Royal Warrant, and a three-figure price tag on a bottle that smells like it contains maybe fifty cents worth of raw material in a sea of Iso-E super?<br />
<br />
I wanted to love this. On paper, it seems like the most enchanting perfume ever. And then, in reality, it's like most Penhaligon's fragrances - barely there and barely projecting. All the promise is in writing and none of it delivers.<br />
<br />
It's not a bad fragrance, not at all. But there's no opulence whatsoever. Just a massive underachievement coasting on its famous name.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="656957"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=656957#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent628371" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc628371" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Paula80"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/50645"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.50645.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Paula80" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Moresque/Oroluna-41460.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41460.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oroluna"title="Oroluna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma628371ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd628371" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/50645">Paula80</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-09-09">09/09/15 07:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>notes from Penhaligon's website:<br />
<br />
head notes: Quince, Rosewater, Carrot Seed, Coriander Seed, Saffron<br />
heart notes: Moroccan Rose Absolute, Bulgarian Rose Oil, Freesia, Indian Magnolia, Peony, Iris<br />
base notes: Honey, White Musk, Cedarwood, Sandalwood, Benzoin Resin, Tonka Bean</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="628371"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=628371#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent617223" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc617223" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma617223ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd617223" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-08-01">08/01/15 13:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara is a masterpiece creation. In my mind the best part of this fragrance is on the dry down. The floral tones smell divine. It is almost as though there are multiple stages to this fragrance which is great. The opening is quite loud and it softens down amazingly.<br />
This is a great mix of both English and Indian elements. Betrand has done amazingly with this creation. This to me is a versatile fragrance. When I wear it I get a number of compliments. Although heavily floral I think a man can easily pull this off. It has an "exotic" smell. As stated it is an ideal scent to wear to a wedding. Wearing this is always a pleasure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="617223"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=617223#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent615411" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc615411" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gaz525"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/447907"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.447907.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gaz525" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elizabeth-and-James/Nirvana-Rose-40267.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40267.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nirvana Rose"title="Nirvana Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma615411ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd615411" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/447907">gaz525</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-26">07/26/15 06:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is beautiful!  I get ok longevity out of this,first hour is very loud,followed by two hours of a cloud of fragrance around you then a skin scent.  Starts off very floral with sour fruit and an almost oud note.  Then it becomes very floral and sparkling, in the dry down the floral continues but a ginger/cinnamon starts to eminate under the florals.  Contrary to what others say I find this very unique,it morphs from one fragrance to another,just when you think it smells one way it then changes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="615411"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=615411#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent612675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc612675" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Skinscents4Fusspots"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/119688"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.119688.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Skinscents4Fusspots" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Poison-Girl-Eau-De-Toilette-41809.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41809.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Poison Girl Eau De Toilette"title="Poison Girl Eau De Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma612675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd612675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/119688">Skinscents4Fusspots</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-16">07/16/15 07:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Super fresh and full of sweet floral notes. I tried this in my search for a perfume with a good freesia note and it was one of the nicest I found. Dior For ever and ever was more intense, but this is a good alternative if that is too strong for you. I kept smelling my arm once I had this on. Very classy and natural smelling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="612675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=612675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent607703" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
