align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="607703"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=607703#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent605081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc605081" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oks-oks"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/881865"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.881865.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="oks-oks" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Jour-d-Hermes-17076.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17076.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jour d'Hermes"title="Jour d'Hermes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma605081ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd605081" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/881865">oks-oks</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-18">06/18/15 11:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not so thrilled with this one. It is a sweet fruity floral with a lot of rose. I find it quite stuffy and not uplifting.There is no freshness in this fragrance whatsoever. I can smell a lot of chemical musk here and that is always a bummer for me. It is not Oriental, to my taste (and I like Orientals), there is no deepness or spice. Just fruity rose.<br />
<br />
The projection is minimal after the first 15 minutes and the longevity is about 2 hours with this minimal projection. Definitely not a winner (meanwhile I really like their Iris Prima from the same collection)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="605081"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=605081#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent604160" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc604160" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="racb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.927134.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="racb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Black-Orchid-Eau-de-Toilette-31969.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31969.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"title="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma604160ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd604160" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134">racb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-15">06/15/15 11:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not what I expected at all.<br />
<br />
I expected something sweet and musky but this is very green and dewy. I don't get India at all, more English country gardens. It has a delicate sweetness which is very pleasant.<br />
<br />
Edit, I ended up buying a full bottle of this as it was such a grower and unlike anything else in my collection. I agree with Gaz, I find it quite a unique fragrance, and nothing like Coco Mademoiselle, which I find far too sweet and heavy.<br />
<br />
It's certainly very floral to begin with, but the citrus stops the floral notes from becoming cloying. Quince was an original idea, where it could have been lemon or bergamot. As this dries down the deep spices come into play, leaving a delicate musky undertone on the skin.<br />
<br />
Smooth, rounded and sophisticated, as I would expect from Penhaligon's.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="604160"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=604160#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent595878" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc595878" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alvin.tan.wx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/855072"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.855072.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alvin.tan.wx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma595878ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd595878" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/855072">alvin.tan.wx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-18">05/18/15 08:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance bursts into a delightful mix of fruit and flowers, notably a light fruit with a very prominent rose note. In fact, the longer I wear this the more I feel it is about the fruit rather than the rose. According to Fragantica, this fruity note is quince, which unfortunately, I have not had the pleasure of trying. This is a very unique  fragrance that is immensely pleasurable to wear. It is an uplifting perfume, full of life and joy and light!<br />
<br />
If this is an "oriental" fragrance, it is certainly not rich or opulent like Guerlain's vanilla-overdosed orientals. Nor is it spicy and resinous like Serge Lutens' classics. This is a light and highly wearable fragrance that is versatile and would do well in many situations. <br />
<br />
However, Vaara's lightness and wearability has also compromised its longevity. Although sillage is decent, it does not seem to last longer than 4-5 hours on my skin. For an eau de parfum, this is quite disappointing. For that price tag, I am not sure I would recommend this fragrance to anyone but the most hardcore fans of Penhaligon's or Bertrand Duchaufour.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="595878"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=595878#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent595353" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc595353" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aistionnelle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/475375"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.475375.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aistionnelle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Torrente/L-Or-de-Torrente-Eau-de-Parfum-2466.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2466.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Or de Torrente Eau de Parfum"title="L'Or de Torrente Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma595353ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd595353" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/475375">aistionnelle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-16">05/16/15 14:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gentle, floral, summery scent. Develops rather unpredictably like most of Ducharfour`s `children` .Opening is fruity with a bit unusual quince (never smelled it before in a perfume !)and apple which is not mentioned in the notes.But I can recognize it.The closer heart is the more flowers we can smell: rose, peony and magnolia -give the clear and fresh sensation.<br />
A real star of the  composition is freesia.Unique, semi sweet and gentle Also fresh enough to make a good impression.I can also detect a powdery, white iris surrounded by musky accents.It lasts only for some moments.Another mark are spices, beautifully mingled with  honey to sweeten Vaara . Tonka as well as sandalwood and a hint of benzoin appear in the drydown. <br />
Average longevity and sillage, but all the ingredients are mixed in the best way. Scent is dreamy and a bit mysterious.<br />
Sniffing Vaara  I can easily imagine a young and beautiful bride dressed in fuchsia dress, just an hour before ritual wedding in India. She is smiling, a bit lost in her thoughts, half way between happiness and anxiety, expecting a long but joyful day.Standing in a big window in shimmering sun she is  sending kisses to her cousins and friends downstairs.<br />
Parents are also here.It`s time to go :)!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="595353"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=595353#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent561729" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc561729" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma561729ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd561729" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-24">01/24/15 13:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok, it's time for Bertrand Duchaufour to move on to a new theme.  I am a bit tired of the woody/resins base with the green/tangy fruit on top.  Here is a list of perfumes that are all in the same vein:  Enchanted Forest, Aedes de Venustas EDP, Mohur, Fusion Sacree-Elle...those are just the ones I have sampled.  Vaara smells very similar to those previously mentioned.  The tangy fruit is very strong and remains present into the drydown.  The rose is nice and clean.  This makes a nice summer or spring perfume, but I would like to see something new from this nose instead of variations on cassis.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="561729"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=561729#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent541476" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc541476" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rossyegio5"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/628310"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.628310.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rossyegio5" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Memoir-Woman-10146.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10146.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Memoir Woman"title="Memoir Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma541476ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd541476" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/628310">rossyegio5</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-11-16">11/16/14 09:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Una delicatissima rosellina bianca indiana, dolce, leggera, un'acqua di rose talmente lieve e innocente da sembrare pi un tonico struccante che un profumo...Adatta o ad una ragazza molto giovane o ad una nonnina appassionata di rose, che ha sempre utilizzato confortanti colonie inglesi alla rosa.<br />
Simile a Mohur Neela Vermeire.<br />
Profumo pulito,carino ma non emozionante.<br />
Un bel regalo per una cresimanda...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="541476"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=541476#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent539813" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc539813" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ivyheel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.43035.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ivyheel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Bergamote-Soleil-35155.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35155.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bergamote Soleil"title="Bergamote Soleil"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma539813ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd539813" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43035">ivyheel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-11-10">11/10/14 18:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you have not had the opportunity to sample this but want to know what it smells like:<br />
<br />
Hermes Un Jardin Sur le Nil + rose = Vaara<br />
<br />
That's the first thing that came to mind when I tried this, before looking up the notes. I suspect the carrot seed is largely responsible for that. Very fresh and clean, and 100% unisex to my nose. The rose is most prominent, with some subtle fruitiness added by quince. This is not a strong fragrance, but wafts gently as you move. This would be great in warm weather, but right now it it cold in my part of the universe and I don't feel like I'm doing Vaara justice. Will wait a few months.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="539813"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=539813#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent509944" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc509944" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="UdayLalan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/31929"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="UdayLalan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boadicea-the-Victorious/Blue-Sapphire-18518.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18518.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blue Sapphire"title="Blue Sapphire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma509944ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd509944" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/31929">UdayLalan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-02">08/02/14 07:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very nice smelling perfume, not very masculine.<br />
A man could pull this off. Its like you are attending <br />
a wedding in India where its a custom (in some<br />
parts of India) to sprinkle Rose water on guests.<br />
<br />
  I wouldn't buy this becoz right now as I am into<br />
ultra masculine scents like leather oud etc.,<br />
But that doesn't take away anything from this<br />
well blended perfume. I tried all the scents of<br />
Penhaligon and this is the best.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="509944"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=509944#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent509483" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc509483" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JPS1979"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/813065"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.813065.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JPS1979" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Joop/Wow-42887.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42887.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wow!"title="Wow!"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma509483ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd509483" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/813065">JPS1979</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-31">07/31/14 17:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells so lovely!  It is an elixir that envelops you in the juicy wonderfulness of a dewy morning in far away India.  I have never quite smelled something like this.  The opening is an immediate burst of zesty fresh green.  After about an hour, I get the rose and magnolia, while the green takes a break.  Later, it dries down and settles into a rosy sandalwood with saffron and rose water.  Deliciousness for all!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="509483"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=509483#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent509298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc509298" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="becuille"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/768337"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.768337.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="becuille" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vero-Profumo/Kiki-Eau-de-Parfum-10117.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10117.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kiki Eau de Parfum"title="Kiki Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma509298ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd509298" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/768337">becuille</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-31">07/31/14 05:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Zing! This one is very fresh and zesty. I'm not really familiar enough with the smell of quince to comment on it in particular, all I can do is assume it's the unfamiliar, juicy note I get here. <br />
<br />
My only complaint about this is that there's a hint of a synthetic, detergent sort of smell lurking in the background for the first hour or so. It leaves and the rest it really nice, but I don't care for that note at all. <br />
<br />
I don't really get rose at all, which seems different to many other reviewers. To me, this is a zesty, fruity and at times almost tea-like scent. I've talked before about how impressed I am with the masterful blending that goes on with a Penhaligon's fragrance, but I do wish I could detect a bit more tonka bean. I cannot get enough tonka! <br />
<br />
Truly unisex, I can see this being a great any day kind of fragrance for a guy and a great spring/summer frag for a woman. <br />
<br />
Moderate sillage and like other perfumes from this house, amazing longevity - if any other niche perfumiers are reading this, please, please find out what Penhaligon's does to get such amazing longevity and do the same!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="509298"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=509298#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent503049" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc503049" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tigerlillian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40335"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.40335.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tigerlillian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Jasmine-Sambac-Marigold-49714.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49714.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jasmine Sambac & Marigold"title="Jasmine Sambac & Marigold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma503049ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd503049" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40335">Tigerlillian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-09">07/09/14 10:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Juicy with delicious quince and floral happiness right on first spritz, like an abundant spring bouquet of dewy freesias and peonies. Then a clean and luminous rose takes center stage with the velvety feel of magnolia petals, warm honey and soft musk.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately, I don't get any obvious carrot seed or coriander, but there is a cleanness and depth to Vaara that could be attributed to these spice notes.<br />
<br />
The wood base of cedar and sandalwood is well balanced and does well in making the flowers radiate. Benzoin and tonka, along with the honey give a roundness suggestive of full, sweet petals.<br />
<br />
Vaara is beautifully and simply a bright, full-bodied floral fragrance that will make your heart swell with delight when you wear it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="503049"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=503049#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent483917" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;        <br />
