  <br />
    <br />
<br />
  <br />
10 /10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="483917"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=483917#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent483814" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc483814" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="appleberry37"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/786155"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="appleberry37" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma483814ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd483814" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/786155">appleberry37</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-09">05/09/14 09:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smells okay for $160/100ml in the U.S. A bit fakey smell meaning not that natural.I could get tired of this scent but this and lily of the valley are best of all penhaligons. <br />
<br />
However, this is ridiculously priced at $360(more than twice) in South Korean department stores....other brands like creed,diptyque, byredo and annick goutal don't charge twice as much....and I'd say goodbye. Not happy with the company doing this weird marketing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="483814"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=483814#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent449805" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc449805" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Roge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.431088.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Roge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma449805ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd449805" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088">Roge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-24">01/24/14 21:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Is it girly? Is it manly? Well...it depends. The first 2 hours are definitely reserved for women. Feminine green rose combo gives an almost white floral accord which dominates the opening. Slight sandy rose appears but not for long. At this point, my skin is starting to venture into lemon territory with a full blast of magnolia and freesia. Out of nowhere, more sandy rose and lavender appears thus completely ignoring the perfume pyramid. Big time musks and cedar rolls out the red carpet for the manly section of Vaara....and that too is short lived. What was once strong musk and cedar mellows and segues to a breath of tonka. The fanfare is deserving. What else would you expect from the man that made Ashoka and Fusion Sacree?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="449805"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=449805#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent443596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc443596" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DoraRoxx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/103138"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.103138.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DoraRoxx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-Neige-56737.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56737.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soleil Neige"title="Soleil Neige"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma443596ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd443596" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/103138">DoraRoxx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-07">01/07/14 04:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If u like roses. Go with it. I think it is very feminin scent. Sillage and longevity are more then moderate. For young girls to heavy. Changes after 2 hours into a soft balsamic/honey floral drydown. For me it is not special enough.<br />
<br />
Rating: 4/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="443596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=443596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent432100" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc432100" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavaman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148843"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.148843.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavaman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma432100ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd432100" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148843">lavaman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-03">12/03/13 02:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yeah I would refer to this as an unisex scent..The citrus burst open with freshness which floats away rather fast before you start to smell the intensity of the corrianderand saffron. The intensity reminds  me of a 1980s men's power house fragrance and that power last for about 2 hours or so on me. After the 2 hour spiciness a mellower softer scent emerges the flowers blend wonderfully with the sandalwood and cedar for a velvet powderiness which is heavenly... COmplex intoxicating and worth the money, just don't spray on too much, this scent goes a long long way</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="432100"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=432100#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent429162" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc429162" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Donna Anna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/695996"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.695996.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Donna Anna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/L-Eau-d-Hiver-2797.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2797.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau d'Hiver"title="L'Eau d'Hiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma429162ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd429162" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/695996">Donna Anna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-23">11/23/13 14:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara is a really really interesting fragrance. It is more like a bottle full of surprises (All of them good ones of course!) It is a very complex fragrance with so many exotic and beautiful notes and each of them compete for your attention and that is the secret to its surprising nature, because each time a different note wins the competition. It is like every time that you spray it on yourself you are getting a slightly different perfume than other days. This chameleon like aspect of it makes it very dear to me. Every time I spray it I ask myself: "Who is going to win today? The spicy saffron and coriander? Or will Vaara be a floral scent today and give me the luscious rose and magnolia? Or will the winners of today be the incense-like notes like sandal wood? Or maybe Vaara would be sweet and creamy like honey today?" You never know!<br />
<br />
The most interesting and original note in this concoction in my opinion is the carrot seed which is its wild card. Every time it appears it gives a devious twist to the whole composition. It is very interesting. I love it. <br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
I was a bit surprised at first that Vaara was listed as unisex. But after wearing it for a while I realised there are some days that it smells really salty believe it or not and on those days specially when the musk and carrot seeds are louder I can see a man wearing this perfume. But most of the time it is really feminine.<br />
<br />
This fragrance is really a masterpiece. It is really well crafted. It changes all the time and all its notes be it on the top or heart or base remain and play with each other a most interesting game till the last molecule is evaporated. Every sniff is a surprise and takes you to a different place.<br />
<br />
My only complaint is that it is rather fleeting and sadly on me it lasts no more than 3 hours usually. After that every so often after I have already given up and forgotten all about it I see a note jump out at me and flee again into oblivion. But the scent as a whole evaporates too quickly. That makes it not such a good value for the money. The sillage is quite modest too.That's a pity since even though I am not a fan of too loud and in your face fragrances, but on this occasion I would have wanted others to enjoy this olfactory symphony along with me.<br />
<br />
It is fancy and sophisticated enough to be worn in any evening occasion but its light touch makes it also suitable for daytime wear. I would say it is also suitable for all four seasons since it is so versatile . Light and floral enough for summer, but spicy and warm enough for winter.<br />
<br />
All in all a great fragrance and something truly original at last!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="429162"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=429162#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent411540" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc411540" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cologneking"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/26564"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.26564.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cologneking" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Brit-Rhythm-18903.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18903.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burberry Brit Rhythm"title="Burberry Brit Rhythm"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma411540ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd411540" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/26564">cologneking</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-30">09/30/13 16:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Vaara is a very floral fragrance!  I do NOT see how this scent is "UNISEX"?  As it wears, the florals become creamier, not gourmand, but softer.  The florals are a soft rose, dewey magnolia and dewey orange blossoms, with an iris accent.  In the final stages of life of this fragrance, a soft white musk accompanied by amber and a little vanilla make an appearance; this is NOT a gourmand vanilla or sweetnes, but a soft sweet sueded leather or unburned incense...NOT smoky at all!<br />
<br />
The sillage is moderate and can be heavy if overused and the longevity is better than average; so spritz lightly!  NOT to wear into the office if you DON'T want to be noticed, fellas!<br />
<br />
As a guy, I enjoy it...maybe worn under a heavy sweater to mute the florals a bit.  Spray after a shower in the morning so that Vaara can age some so that the florals are tamed by the creamier notes.<br />
<br />
Would I buy a full bottle, probably, YES!<br />
<br />
I would recommend Vaara to the guy who is secure in himself!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="411540"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=411540#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent404345" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc404345" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CoolBreezes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/242660"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.242660.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CoolBreezes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Organza-4.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Organza"title="Organza"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma404345ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd404345" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/242660">CoolBreezes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-08">09/08/13 15:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A warm, spicy, delicious rose with the freshness of quince.  I love this scent and would wear it year round.  The only drawback is that it is rather fleeting.  On me, one spray is gone within 2 hours.  I'd probably need to layer a few sprays, and it would be worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="404345"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=404345#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent393977" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc393977" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="IsaIsabella"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/426860"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.426860.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="IsaIsabella" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-s-Secret/Bombshell-10190.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10190.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bombshell"title="Bombshell"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma393977ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd393977" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/426860">IsaIsabella</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-08">08/08/13 02:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Vaara conjures the image of blooming taif roses nestled on a shimmery moonstone-coloured silk cushion while being bathed in the comforting orange glow of the sun. The mild spiciness of the Indian air can be smelt in the background. A lovely orangey-pink scent.<br />
<br />
The dry down, however, is less magical, with the blurry trace of roses and the prominence of powdery and balmy notes. Here, the colour morphs into something pinkish purple.<br />
<br />
Sillage is good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="393977"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=393977#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent393538" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc393538" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tremere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/400701"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.400701.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tremere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Overture-Man-55859.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55859.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Overture Man"title="Overture Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma393538ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd393538" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/400701">Tremere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-06">08/06/13 18:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unmistakable as a Bertrand Duchaufour creation; as multifaceted as Sartorial, as sticky as Traverse du Bosphore, and as evocative as Avignon. Vaara's top notes shimmer over rich, deep powerhouse florals. I agree with originaldeftom (first!) that quince is the distinguishing note and, I would add, what distinguishes Vaara from anything else on the market.<br />
<br />
Indeed, the only comparison I can make between Vaara and another fragrance is with one of my all time favourites, Poison by Christian Dior (the original 1985 edit). Here the honeyed plum has been replaced by quince but I would not be surprised to learn Duchaufour has made use of the same lush alpha- and beta-damascone combination of the Dior masterpiece.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="393538"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=393538#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent385178" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc385178" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="originaldeftom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7036.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="originaldeftom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma385178ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd385178" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036">originaldeftom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-10">07/10/13 16:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>WOW!  I have the privilege to write the first review (for once)!<br />
<br />
Just being launched in London recently and this fragrance has truly taken the city by storm.  Obviously it is inspired by Indian culture (both product colours and name give it away).  <br />
<br />
The ingredients are truly unusual and extremely well blended (despite their wonderful weirdness).  Bertrand Duchaufour who I see as the Heston Blumenthal of perfumery (in other words what Heston is for the world of palates, Bertrand is for the olfactory world) created a truly wonderful concoction of florals, fruits &amp; seeds, woods, et al without creating a heavy, cloying oriental monster.  No, he mastered a truly delightful, fruity, wet and juicy, interesting and compelling new age world scent (I can literally see the Bollywood belly dancers in a promotional video in front of me).<br />
<br />
It is truly a pleasure to sniff this over and over again.  True that the quince note "makes" the fragrance (and I love everything about the quince for my father planted and made jam and jelly from it when I was a child) but it is the whole vision and concept that turned this brief into a truly modern contemporary masterpiece, I dare to say.<br />
<br />
Best season for this is the "Indian Summer" for the scent breathes melancholy to me and funnily enough, despite being a "floriental" it is somewhat on the cool side.<br />
<br />
For me it represents the beauty of Indian fabrics, fruit/ flower markets and that cool morning/ evening breeze on a perfect Indian summer day in late August.<br />
<br />
I would wear this on my Wedding Day (in India)!<br />
<br />
10/10 from concept to selection of ingredients to quality of ingredients to finished product to packaging (to customer service in one of London's most prestigious Arcades).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="385178"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=385178#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent385178" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc385178" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="originaldeftom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7036.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="originaldeftom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma385178ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd385178" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7036">originaldeftom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-10">07/10/13 16:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>WOW!  I have the privilege to write the first review (for once)!<br />
<br />
Just being launched in London recently and this fragrance has truly taken the city by storm.  Obviously it is inspired by Indian culture (both product colours and name give it away).  <br />
<br />
The ingredients are truly unusual and extremely well blended (despite their wonderful weirdness).  Bertrand Duchaufour who I see as the Heston Blumenthal of perfumery (in other words what Heston is for the world of palates, Bertrand is for the olfactory world) created a truly wonderful concoction of florals, fruits &amp; seeds, woods, et al without creating a heavy, cloying oriental monster.  No, he mastered a truly delightful, fruity, wet and juicy, interesting and compelling new age world scent (I can literally see the Bollywood belly dancers in a promotional video in front of me).<br />
<br />
It is truly a pleasure to sniff this over and over again.  True that the quince note "makes" the fragrance (and I love everything about the quince for my father planted and made jam and jelly from it when I was a child) but it is the whole vision and concept that turned this brief into a truly modern contemporary masterpiece, I dare to say.<br />
<br />
Best season for this is the "Indian Summer" for the scent breathes melancholy to me and funnily enough, despite being a "floriental" it is somewhat on the cool side.<br />
<br />
For me it represents the beauty of Indian fabrics, fruit/ flower markets and that cool morning/ evening breeze on a perfect Indian summer day in late August.<br />
<br />
I would wear this on my Wedding Day (in India)!<br />
<br />
10/10 from concept to selection of ingredients to quality of ingredients to finished product to packaging (to customer service in one of London's most prestigious Arcades).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="385178"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=385178#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1131611" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1131611" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="esikko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/209832"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.209832.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="esikko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clarins/Eau-Dynamisante-2825.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2825.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Dynamisante"title="Eau Dynamisante"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1131611ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1131611" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/209832">esikko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-06">01/06/20 12:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I know it is super subjective, but for me this perfume means Springtime, Easter, April sunshine. There is something very sunny, innocent and joyful in this perfume. I do not mean sickening silliness. There is nothing artificially sweet in Vaara - on the contrary, there is something bittersweet, and i mean this more emotionally than olfactory. I think about movies based on  Jane Austen's novels, childhood days in the garden, about saffron flowers covering the  meadows in Tatra mountains. I love the unique smell of quince fruit - Penhaligon's did an excellent job, again, in interpreting Nature's best perfumes. It is certainly not like any other perfume I know.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1131611"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1131611#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent818187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc818187" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="adice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.885210.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="adice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Histoires-de-Parfums/1804-4486.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4486.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1804"title="1804"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma818187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd818187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/885210">adice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-30">04/30/17 15:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dear Vaara, <br />
<br />
You are my sun, my moon, and all of my perfume stars.<br />
<br />
My HOLY GRAIL. You can really smell the quince and rose. If you're not familiar with what a quince fruit smells like I'm not sure how you'll perceive this...but it's a rose water and quince bomb. Lasts through my entire 8 hour office workday with moderate to low sillage. Perfect for spring or summer but can be worn all year round. I mostly get indirect compliments when I wear this such as; "something smells really great over here..." but who needs compliments when you KNOW you smell amazing.<br />
<br />
Forever and always, XOXO</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="818187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=818187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent824835" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc824835" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="anilinam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1065439"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1065439.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="anilinam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Chinatown-1300.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1300.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chinatown"title="Chinatown"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma824835ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd824835" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1065439">anilinam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-21">05/21/17 23:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Missk's comment is on point.  All I can add is:<br />
<br />
1.  Rose scents are very volatile.  I recommend applying an oil prior to spraying; this helps with the issue of longevity.  It's even better if I can use also as a base some rose scented lotion after the oil.<br />
<br />
2.   Sometimes a girl (or, why not a guy) just wants to smell like roses.<br />
<br />
I own many rose fragrances, I love to wear them as a comfort scent, something easy, warm and light for the weekends mostly.  Here's the difference between Vaara and Vera Wang's Truly Pink or Cartier's Goutte de Rose:<br />
<br />
While simple rose scents are linear, Vaara takes you on a journey.  It is an easy journey, one in which someone else is carrying your suitcases.  Bertrand Duchaufour is a genius at giving you a tour.  He presents the magnolia and freesia, the quince, the carrot seeds and coriander,  while carrying a 3 dozen roses bouquet,  as he takes you on this voyage, that begins with a very rosy "feminine" vibe and ends in a more "masculine" cedar and clean musk spectrum.<br />
<br />
I treasure Vaara, and only wear it when I can take the time, to just sit down and enjoy the journey</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="824835"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=824835#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent615411" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc615411" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gaz525"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/447907"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.447907.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gaz525" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elizabeth-and-James/Nirvana-Rose-40267.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40267.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nirvana Rose"title="Nirvana Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma615411ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd615411" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/447907">gaz525</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-26">07/26/15 06:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is beautiful!  I get ok longevity out of this,first hour is very loud,followed by two hours of a cloud of fragrance around you then a skin scent.  Starts off very floral with sour fruit and an almost oud note.  Then it becomes very floral and sparkling, in the dry down the floral continues but a ginger/cinnamon starts to eminate under the florals.  Contrary to what others say I find this very unique,it morphs from one fragrance to another,just when you think it smells one way it then changes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="615411"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=615411#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18719" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1637268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1637268" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="M-as-Marin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1202613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="M-as-Marin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Oud-Wood-1826.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1826.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Wood"title="Oud Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1637268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1637268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1202613">M-as-Marin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-03">09/03/22 08:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vaara by itself is a good fragrance if we ignore all the comparisons with some other rose-forward fragrances.During my time with this scent, I had three main issues. One is it is not worth over $200 USD no matter how good the presentation looks, who was the perfumer, and how many natural ingredients are there inside.<br />
<br />
The second issue is with the performance. It is not bad as for example Jo Malone fragrances tend to be, but for this amount of money, the quality of the fragrance isnt at the highest level I wanted for more than four hours.<br />
<br />
The third and last complaint was the capture of the spirit of Jodhpur. If no one told you, I highly doubt you would guess right which country was the inspiration for this creation.<br />
<br />
TOP NOTES<br />
Vaara opens up with a thoughtful and carefully mixed watery rose, and a mixture of quince with hints of spices. The rose here is watery but much soapier than todays standards. It mostly reminds me of fragrances that used this kind of rose in perfumes from 30 to 50 years ago that were worn by maybe a little more mature and well-dressed ladies of high society.<br />
<br />
HEART NOTES<br />
As the fragrance gently transitions into the floral heart, the rose starts to settle down, and the magnolia switches places with the citruses from the opening.<br />
<br />
I have to point out that for this amount of money, the fragrance is shockingly sharp and synthetic which pinches my nose in the wrong way.<br />
<br />
However, the fragrance shines the most when its fully dried down when woody, spicy and sweeter aspects get their chance to play the main role.<br />
<br />
BASE NOTES<br />
There is no denying that Vaara is primary a floral fragrance, and womens fragrance, no matter what Penhaligons marketing is trying to tell you.<br />
<br />
The unisex part comes from the base notes when the honey, musk, and saffron get intensified. There are zero sandalwood, benzoin, and tonka beans notes here, but what I found is a high dosage of Iso E Super which can mimic javanol  industrially made sandalwood, musk, and cedarwood notes.<br />
<br />
I bet that Bertrand knew that without Iso E Super this fragrance would be completely gone from the skin in one to two hours.<br />
<br />
Read the full review at scentgrail.com</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1637268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1637268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent411540" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc411540" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cologneking"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/26564"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.26564.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cologneking" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Brit-Rhythm-18903.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18903.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burberry Brit Rhythm"title="Burberry Brit Rhythm"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma411540ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd411540" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/26564">cologneking</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-30">09/30/13 16:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Vaara is a very floral fragrance!  I do NOT see how this scent is "UNISEX"?  As it wears, the florals become creamier, not gourmand, but softer.  The florals are a soft rose, dewey magnolia and dewey orange blossoms, with an iris accent.  In the final stages of life of this fragrance, a soft white musk accompanied by amber and a little vanilla make an appearance; this is NOT a gourmand vanilla or sweetnes, but a soft sweet sueded leather or unburned incense...NOT smoky at all!<br />
<br />
The sillage is moderate and can be heavy if overused and the longevity is better than average; so spritz lightly!  NOT to wear into the office if you DON'T want to be noticed, fellas!<br />
<br />
As a guy, I enjoy it...maybe worn under a heavy sweater to mute the florals a bit.  Spray after a shower in the morning so that Vaara can age some so that the florals are tamed by the creamier notes.<br />
<br />
Would I buy a full bottle, probably, YES!<br />
<br />
I would recommend Vaara to the guy who is secure in himself!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="411540"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=411540#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent561729" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc561729" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma561729ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd561729" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-24">01/24/15 13:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok, it's time for Bertrand Duchaufour to move on to a new theme.  I am a bit tired of the woody/resins base with the green/tangy fruit on top.  Here is a list of perfumes that are all in the same vein:  Enchanted Forest, Aedes de Venustas EDP, Mohur, Fusion Sacree-Elle...those are just the ones I have sampled.  Vaara smells very similar to those previously mentioned.  The tangy fruit is very strong and remains present into the drydown.  The rose is nice and clean.  This makes a nice summer or spring perfume, but I would like to see something new from this nose instead of variations on cassis.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="561729"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=561729#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent605081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc605081" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oks-oks"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/881865"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.881865.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="oks-oks" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Jour-d-Hermes-17076.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17076.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jour d'Hermes"title="Jour d'Hermes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma605081ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd605081" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/881865">oks-oks</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-18">06/18/15 11:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not so thrilled with this one. It is a sweet fruity floral with a lot of rose. I find it quite stuffy and not uplifting.There is no freshness in this fragrance whatsoever. I can smell a lot of chemical musk here and that is always a bummer for me. It is not Oriental, to my taste (and I like Orientals), there is no deepness or spice. Just fruity rose.<br />
<br />
The projection is minimal after the first 15 minutes and the longevity is about 2 hours with this minimal projection. Definitely not a winner (meanwhile I really like their Iris Prima from the same collection)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="605081"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=605081#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1285681" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1285681" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumedParrot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/90056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.90056.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumedParrot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Cuir-Beluga-1019.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1019.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cuir Bluga"title="Cuir Bluga"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1285681ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1285681" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/90056">PerfumedParrot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-02">02/02/21 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It just doesnt work with my body chemistry. Against my skin, it brings out a spicy B.O curry vibe with this. Im not sure which note/notes trigger this, but I like to avoid it. It is like Mohur by Neela Vermeire Creations.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18719"comment_id="1285681"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Vaara-18719.html?ccid=1285681#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18719" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

            <div style="margin-left: -0.65rem" id="anchormehere45646">

        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">19.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Givenchy.html" class="en2inter">Givenchy</a>

        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
